column2: The Shadowmasters of Telflamm are a religious thieves' guild that operates throughout the eastern lands of Faerûn. Their headquarters are located in Telflamm, where they rule the city in all but name. The guild has operated within Telflamm since the year 927 DR, and they are dedicated to the deity Mask, maintaining a strong alliance with his church.
Lord Master Most Hidden is at the helm of the guild's vast network of agents.
Thieves are new members of the Shadowmasters, and they are expected to follow orders.
Agents are employed to carry out the will of the Guildmasters, while enjoying a degree of independence.
Master Thieves handle most of the day to day activities of the guild.
Guildmasters run the Shadowmasters' operations from behind the scenes.

The Shadowmasters send their regards.\nYour recent moves have been observed by our agents, and we understand that you plan to join us. We believe that wealth belongs to those who possess the skills to acquire it, as long as subtlety is employed. Still interested?
The Shadowmasters have finally established a guild in your province. You are entitled to a share of their profits, so it's only a matter of time before wealth starts pouring in your coffers.
The Shadowmasters of Telflamm are deeply entrenched in one of your provinces, and they're disrupting your economy with their criminal activities.
We'll hire some adventurers to destroy them.
Intriguing. I think I'll pay them a visit.
This province harbors a guild of the Shadowmasters of Telflamm.

Shadow Walkers are people who have experienced a ritual of the god Mask that attunes a person's body to shadow. A Shadow Walker sacrifices a small amount of health, receiving a boost to intrigue and combat skill in return.
